content: Add push notification support by following existing source-code rules and extension patterns. Create src/workflow_engine/processors/push_processor.py with class PushProcessor, update src/workflow_engine/processors/__init__.py and src/workflow_engine/runtime/registry.py to register it, and add tests/test_push_processor.py using unittest for a successful push dispatch via build_default_runtime.

{
  "summary": "Added PushProcessor implementation following existing processor patterns, registered it in the default processors registry, and added a unit test verifying successful push dispatch via build_default_runtime.",
  "project": {
    "language": "python"
  },
  "files": [
    {
      "path": "src/workflow_engine/processors/push_processor.py",
      "content": """"Push notification processor implementation."""

from __future__ import annotations

from workflow_engine.contracts.work_item import WorkItem
from workflow_engine.processors.base_processor import BaseProcessor


class PushProcessor(BaseProcessor):
    supported_channel = "push"

    def _deliver(self, item: WorkItem) -> str:
        device = item.payload.get("device", "unknown")
        message = item.payload.get("message", "no-message")
        return f"push delivered to {device}: {message}"

      "path": "src/workflow_engine/runtime/registry.py",
      "content": """"Default processor registry."""

from workflow_engine.processors.email_processor import EmailProcessor
from workflow_engine.processors.push_processor import PushProcessor
from workflow_engine.processors.sms_processor import SmsProcessor
from workflow_engine.processors.webhook_processor import WebhookProcessor


def default_processors() -> list[PushProcessor | EmailProcessor | SmsProcessor | WebhookProcessor]:
    """Return the list of default processors."""
    return [
        EmailProcessor(),
        PushProcessor(),
        SmsProcessor(),
        WebhookProcessor(),
    ]
"
    },
    {
      "path": "tests/test_push_processor.py",
      "content": """"Tests for the push notification processor."""

import unittest

from workflow_engine.models.ticket import Ticket
from workflow_engine.runtime.bootstrap import build_default_runtime


class PushProcessorTest(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_push_dispatch_succeeds(self) -> None:
        dispatcher, repository = build_default_runtime()

        ticket = Ticket(
            ticket_id="push-123",
            target_channel="push",
            data={"device": "mobile-1", "message": "Hello"},
        )
        repository.save(ticket)

        result = dispatcher.dispatch(ticket)

        self.assertTrue(result.success)
        self.assertIn("mobile-1", result.details)
        self.assertIn("Hello", result.details)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    unittest.main()
